snippet: A Russian man who lost his family in a plane crash and later killed the air traffic controller was stopped from attending a ceremony observing the crash’s anniversary.
abstract: Vitaly Kaloyev, Russian, who in 2004 fatally stabbed an air traffic controller he blamed for the death of his wife and two children in a midair collision, is briefly detained in Munich as he traveled to a ceremony observing the 10-year anniversary of the accident in Germany; he was convicted of murder in Switzerland in 2005, but released two years into an eight-year sentence and deported to Russia.
lead_paragraph: A Russian man who lost his family in a plane crash and later killed the air traffic controller was stopped from attending a ceremony observing the crash’s anniversary.

headline.seo: Killer of Air Traffic Controller Barred From Crash Memorial
headline.main: Plane Crash Remembered; One Mourner Not Welcome
headline.print_headline: Plane Crash Remembered; One Mourner Not Welcome
